title: Understanding and Applying New York State Mathematics Standards
driving_question: How can we apply the New York State P-12 Learning Standards for Mathematics to real-world problems?
short_background_context: In 2013, New York State (NYS) began administering tests designed to assess student performance in accordance with the instructional shifts and rigor demanded by the new New York State P-12 Learning Standards in Mathematics. These tests use multiple-choice questions to assess standard algorithms and conceptual standards. Many questions are framed within the context of real-world applications or require students to complete multiple steps. In 2021, due to the ongoing COVID-19 pandemic, NYSED administered only Session 1 of the Grades 3-8 ELA and Mathematics Tests. The tests included previously administered questions, providing an opportunity for cost savings and ensuring the development of new test forms for future years.
tasks: Analyze the previously administered test questions and identify the mathematical concepts they are assessing.
Apply the identified mathematical concepts to solve real-world problems in the context of Economics, Geometry, Statistics, Health, and Algebra.
Create your own multiple-choice questions that assess the New York State P-12 Learning Standards for Mathematics.
pre_thinking_prompts: What mathematical concepts do you think are being assessed in the test questions?
How can these concepts be applied to real-world problems?
What kind of multiple-choice questions can you create to assess these concepts?
reflection_prompt: Reflect on your understanding of the New York State P-12 Learning Standards for Mathematics. How well were you able to apply these standards to real-world problems? What challenges did you face and how did you overcome them?
ai_tutor_prompts: Can you explain why you chose the mathematical concept you did for the real-world problem?
Why do you think this multiple-choice question accurately assesses the mathematical concept?
How would you explain the solution to your real-world problem to a peer?
remix_zone: Students can remix this problem by choosing different real-world contexts to apply the mathematical concepts, or by creating different types of questions (e.g., open-ended questions, short-answer questions) to assess the concepts.
